00057 /* lustreapi message severity level */
00058 enum llapi_message_level {
00059         LLAPI_MSG_OFF    = 0,
00060         LLAPI_MSG_FATAL  = 1,
00061         LLAPI_MSG_ERROR  = 2,
00062         LLAPI_MSG_WARN   = 3,
00063         LLAPI_MSG_NORMAL = 4,
00064         LLAPI_MSG_INFO   = 5,
00065         LLAPI_MSG_DEBUG  = 6,
00066         LLAPI_MSG_MAX
00067 };
00068 
00069 typedef void (*llapi_log_callback_t)(enum llapi_message_level level, int err,
00070                                      const char *fmt, va_list ap);
00071 
00072 
00073 /* the bottom three bits reserved for llapi_message_level */
00074 #define LLAPI_MSG_MASK          0x00000007
00075 #define LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO      0x00000010
00076 
00077 static inline const char *llapi_msg_level2str(enum llapi_message_level level)
00078 {
00079         static const char *levels[LLAPI_MSG_MAX] = {"OFF", "FATAL", "ERROR",
00080                                                     "WARNING", "NORMAL",
00081                                                     "INFO", "DEBUG"};
00082 
00083         if (level >= LLAPI_MSG_MAX)
00084                 return NULL;
00085 
00086         return levels[level];
00087 }
00088 extern void llapi_msg_set_level(int level);
00089 int llapi_msg_get_level(void);
00090 extern llapi_log_callback_t llapi_error_callback_set(llapi_log_callback_t cb);
00091 extern llapi_log_callback_t llapi_info_callback_set(llapi_log_callback_t cb);
00092 
00093 void llapi_error(enum llapi_message_level level, int err, const char *fmt, ...)
00094         __attribute__((__format__(__printf__, 3, 4)));
00095 #define llapi_err_noerrno(level, fmt, a...)                     \
00096         llapi_error((level) | LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO, 0, fmt, ## a)
00097 void llapi_printf(enum llapi_message_level level, const char *fmt, ...)
00098         __attribute__((__format__(__printf__, 2, 3)));

00100 struct llapi_stripe_param {
00101         unsigned long long      lsp_stripe_size;
00102         char                    *lsp_pool;
00103         int                     lsp_stripe_offset;
00104         int                     lsp_stripe_pattern;
00105         /* Number of stripes. Size of lsp_osts[] if lsp_specific is true.*/
00106         int                     lsp_stripe_count;
00107         bool                    lsp_is_specific;
00108         __u32                   lsp_osts[0];
00109 };

00136 #define VERBOSE_COUNT           0x1
00137 #define VERBOSE_SIZE            0x2
00138 #define VERBOSE_OFFSET          0x4
00139 #define VERBOSE_POOL            0x8
00140 #define VERBOSE_DETAIL          0x10
00141 #define VERBOSE_OBJID           0x20
00142 #define VERBOSE_GENERATION      0x40
00143 #define VERBOSE_MDTINDEX        0x80
00144 #define VERBOSE_LAYOUT          0x100
00145 #define VERBOSE_ALL             (VERBOSE_COUNT | VERBOSE_SIZE | \
00146                                  VERBOSE_OFFSET | VERBOSE_POOL | \
00147                                  VERBOSE_OBJID | VERBOSE_GENERATION |\
00148                                  VERBOSE_LAYOUT)

00150 struct find_param {
00151         unsigned int             fp_max_depth;
00152         dev_t                    fp_dev;
00153         mode_t                   fp_type; /* S_IFIFO,... */
00154         uid_t                    fp_uid;
00155         gid_t                    fp_gid;
00156         time_t                   fp_atime;
00157         time_t                   fp_mtime;
00158         time_t                   fp_ctime;
00159         /* {a,m,c}sign cannot be bitfields due to using pointers to
00160          * access them during argument parsing. */
00161         int                      fp_asign;
00162         int                      fp_msign;
00163         int                      fp_csign;
00164         /* these need to be signed values */
00165         int                      fp_size_sign:2,
00166                                  fp_stripe_size_sign:2,
00167                                  fp_stripe_count_sign:2;
00168         unsigned long long       fp_size;
00169         unsigned long long       fp_size_units;
00170 
00171         unsigned long            fp_zero_end:1,
00172                                  fp_recursive:1,
00173                                  fp_exclude_pattern:1,
00174                                  fp_exclude_type:1,
00175                                  fp_exclude_obd:1,
00176                                  fp_exclude_mdt:1,
00177                                  fp_exclude_gid:1,
00178                                  fp_exclude_uid:1,
00179                                  fp_check_gid:1,
00180                                  fp_check_uid:1,
00181                                  fp_check_pool:1,       /* LOV pool name */
00182                                  fp_check_size:1,       /* file size */
00183                                  fp_exclude_pool:1,
00184                                  fp_exclude_size:1,
00185                                  fp_exclude_atime:1,
00186                                  fp_exclude_mtime:1,
00187                                  fp_exclude_ctime:1,
00188                                  fp_get_lmv:1,  /* get MDT list from LMV */
00189                                  fp_raw:1,      /* do not fill in defaults */
00190                                  fp_check_stripe_size:1, /* LOV stripe size */
00191                                  fp_exclude_stripe_size:1,
00192                                  fp_check_stripe_count:1, /* LOV stripe count */
00193                                  fp_exclude_stripe_count:1,
00194                                  fp_check_layout:1,
00195                                  fp_exclude_layout:1,
00196                                  fp_get_default_lmv:1, /* Get default LMV */
00197                                  fp_migrate:1;
00198 
00199         int                      fp_verbose;
00200         int                      fp_quiet;
00201 
00202         /* regular expression */
00203         char                    *fp_pattern;
00204 
00205         struct  obd_uuid        *fp_obd_uuid;
00206         int                      fp_num_obds;
00207         int                      fp_num_alloc_obds;
00208         int                      fp_obd_index;
00209         int                     *fp_obd_indexes;
00210 
00211         struct  obd_uuid        *fp_mdt_uuid;
00212         int                      fp_num_mdts;
00213         int                      fp_num_alloc_mdts;
00214         int                      fp_mdt_index;
00215         int                     *fp_mdt_indexes;
00216         int                      fp_file_mdt_index;
00217 
00218         size_t                   fp_lum_size;
00219         struct  lov_user_mds_data *fp_lmd;
00220 
00221         char                     fp_poolname[LOV_MAXPOOLNAME + 1];
00222 
00223         __u32                    fp_lmv_stripe_count;
00224         struct lmv_user_md      *fp_lmv_md;
00225 
00226         unsigned long long       fp_stripe_size;
00227         unsigned long long       fp_stripe_size_units;
00228         unsigned long long       fp_stripe_count;
00229         __u32                    fp_layout;
00230 
00231         /* In-process parameters. */
00232         unsigned long            fp_got_uuids:1,
00233                                  fp_obds_printed:1;
00234         unsigned int             fp_depth;
00235 };

00334 /* Changelog interface.  priv is private state, managed internally by these
00335  * functions */
00336 
00337 /* Records received are in extended format now, though most of them are still
00338  * written in disk in changelog_rec format (to save space and time), it's
00339  * converted to extended format in the lustre api to ease changelog analysis. */
00340 #define HAVE_CHANGELOG_EXTEND_REC 1
00341 
00342 extern int llapi_changelog_start(void **priv, enum changelog_send_flag flags,
00343                                  const char *mdtname, long long startrec);
00344 extern int llapi_changelog_fini(void **priv);
00345 extern int llapi_changelog_recv(void *priv, struct changelog_rec **rech);
00346 extern int llapi_changelog_free(struct changelog_rec **rech);
00347 /* Allow records up to endrec to be destroyed; requires registered id. */
00348 extern int llapi_changelog_clear(const char *mdtname, const char *idstr,
00349                                  long long endrec);
